data.why:
The first module I will contribute is a Perl extension for the
    representation and simulation of biochemical reaction networks.
    There are submodules for Substrates, Reactions and Networks and a
    few tools how to manipulate them and an automatic mfile (Matlab)
    generator. I used the module in my PhD thesis to analyze structural
    features of metabolic systems (see
    http://dochost.rz.hu-berlin.de/dissertationen/ebenhoeh-oliver-2003-04-01/)
    and I think that the module might be usefule to researchers in the
    field of system's biology. I called the module Bio::Metabolic, the
    developing site is on sourceforge.net. Project name: bio-metabolic

    I have other modules I consider worth sharing: One is an extension
    to call Matlab from PERL, another is a module implementing highly
    configurable evolutionary algorithms.
